🌹 Streams in the Desert - April 25 ✝️

"And there was Mary Magdalene and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre" ✝️ (Matt. 27:61)

How strange grief is - it doesn't learn, doesn't know, and doesn't want to. 😔 When the mourning women sat by the tomb, did they see the 2,000 years of triumph ahead? Did they see anything but: "Our Christ is gone!"

Yet from their loss came our Christ! Countless grieving hearts have found resurrection in their sorrow. But the mourners only saw death - not that this was preparing for Christ's coronation! 🤴 His silence meant He would rise with tenfold power.

They didn't see it. They cried 😢, left, then returned to the tomb - still just a dark, silent grave.

We're the same. At first, we all sit by our "garden tombs" saying: "This pain can't be fixed! I see no good in it! I refuse comfort!" Yet often, right in our worst troubles, Christ waits to rise again. ✨

Where death seems final, our Savior appears. 🕊️ Where hope ends, new life begins. 🌱 In the darkest night, eternal light dawns. ☀️ Later, we see tombs don't ruin gardens - they make the flowers brighter.

Our joys grow deeper when sorrow waters them. 💧 And sorrow shines when surrounded by God's planted joys. The flowers might not be our favorites - but they're heart-flowers: 💖 love, hope, faith, joy, peace - blooming around every grave in a Christian's heart.

🌹 Christ walked sorrow's path so drear
✝️ To enter into rest;
Should I seek roses blooming here?
🌎 Or think earth's truly blessed?

🌸 Heaven's purest lilies grow
👑 From earth's most painful woe.
Who bears their cross with patience here
🟪 Shall wear king's purple there.
